title: Add static Videos gallery section to About page

requirements.summary: Create a reusable, responsive, glassmorphism-styled HTML5 video gallery component backed by static public assets.
acceptanceCriteria: A new React component exists for displaying videos (grid/cards) and does not depend on the backend.
Videos are loaded from static paths (served by the frontend) and play using the native HTML5 <video> element with controls.
The gallery layout is responsive (1 column on small screens, multiple columns on larger screens) and uses existing glass/neon hover styling patterns.
Each video has an accessible text label (title/caption or aria-label) and does not rely on autoplay by default.

requirements.summary: Add a new 'Videos' section on the About page beneath MediaPortraits and integrate the video gallery into the page layout.
acceptanceCriteria: The About page (`frontend/src/pages/AboutContactPage.tsx`) displays a new 'Videos' section beneath the portrait images.
The section heading and any helper text are in English.
The page remains visually consistent with the current theme and spacing on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Import and render PortfolioVideoGallery below the existing MediaPortraits section, adding an English heading ('Videos') and short descriptive text consistent with current typography and spacing; ensure the section uses the same glass/neon styling patterns used elsewhere (e.g., headings, muted helper text).

requirements.summary: Make video cards performance-aware with no autoplay, optional posters, and aspect-ratio reserved space to prevent layout shifts.
acceptanceCriteria: No videos autoplay on page load; playback begins only via user interaction.
Video cards reserve space using a fixed aspect ratio so the grid does not jump when media loads.
If a poster image is specified for a video entry, it is applied to the <video> element; otherwise a styled fallback placeholder is shown.
Rendering the video section does not break the existing smooth scroll / route transitions and respects reduced-motion preferences (no forced motion effects).

file_operations.description: Implement performance-focused rendering: disable autoplay; set preload to a conservative mode (e.g., metadata); reserve layout using a fixed aspect-ratio wrapper per card; support optional poster per video entry and show a styled fallback placeholder when missing; avoid motion effects that ignore reduced-motion preferences (limit to existing CSS hover styling patterns rather than forcing animations). Compose shadcn-ui Card where used; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
